task.summary: Settings up django project for blog

feat: Add Post and Comment models to blog app
- Created Post model with fields for author, title, text, create_date, and optional published_date. - Added `publish` method to set published_date and save the post. - Defined `approve_comments` method to filter for approved comments. - Implemented `get_absolute_url` in Post to direct users to post_detail view after creation.
- Created Comment model with fields for post, author, text, create_date, and approved_comments. - Added `approve` method to set comment approval status. - Implemented `get_absolute_url` in Comment to redirect to post_list view after comment creation.
This setup links comments to specific posts, enables publishing and approving posts/comments, and configures URL redirects upon creation.

Add forms for Post and Comment models with custom widget styling
- Created PostForm and CommentForm classes in forms.py - Configured Meta classes for Post and Comment to specify model fields - Applied custom CSS classes to widgets for 'title', 'text', and 'author' fields to support styling with CSS - Enables customized form input appearance and enhances UI consistency
settings.py - Set up template and static folder paths in settings.py - included login redirect url

Implement blog views and URL routing for post management
- Added class-based views for blog functionality, including PostListView, PostDetailView, PostCreateView, PostUpdateView, PostDeleteView, and DraftListView. - Integrated LoginRequiredMixin to restrict access to certain views for authenticated users. - Defined custom queryset methods to filter and display published and draft posts. - Configured URL patterns for all blog views, including paths for listing, creating, updating, and deleting posts. - Added an AboutView for static content display. - Ensured proper redirection after login and post actions using success_url and redirect_field_name attributes. - crated base and about html templates

Implement function-based views for post publishing and comment management
- Added function-based views: post_publish, add_comment_to_post, comment_approve, and comment_remove to handle post publishing and comment operations. - Utilized get_object_or_404() for safe retrieval of Post and Comment objects, ensuring robust error handling. - Enabled comment addition to posts with form validation and conditional rendering. - Included comment approval and removal functionalities with appropriate redirections. - Updated URL patterns to support new views, including paths for adding comments, approving/removing comments, and publishing posts. - Ensured all views are protected by the @login_required decorator to restrict access to authenticated users.
HTML templates
- created the html templates to be used in association with the post and comments views and urls

Implementing login and logout urls and login html template - created login url path - created logout url path. This includes kwargs to direct user to new page after logout - created login html template
populated the html base template to be extended by other templates

Extended the base template in all the templates in the blog app
Update post_detail.html and post_list.html templates to display post content, comments, and actions
- Modified post detail template to display post title, content, and publish status. - Added conditional publish button for unpublished posts and post action buttons (edit, delete) for authenticated users. - Enabled comment addition, approval, and removal functionalities, with visibility controlled based on user authentication. - Displayed comments with approval status and author information under each post. - Updated post list template to display a list of posts with title links, publish date, and approved comment count.

Complete blog project with UI improvements, authentication, and model adjustments
- **About Page**: Updated content to detail the site’s purpose and features.
- **Admin Setup**: Registered Post and Comment models in the admin panel; created superuser for management.
**base.html** - Updated navbar: set background color to dark, text to white, and applied `techfont` class. - Renamed main page link to "Home". - Added LinkedIn and GitHub links that open in new tabs. - Replaced logout link with a POST request form for enhanced security. - Removed deprecated glyphicons.
**blog.css** - Changed background color and set navbar text color to white for improved UI consistency.
**models.py** - Removed `timezone.now` function call from `created_date` field for improved model functionality. - Fixed field naming errors and corrected URL references.
**Templates** - Populated templates with required data: - `post_confirm_delete.html` - `post_draft_list.html` - `post_form.html` - `comment_form.html`
**post_detail.html** - Updated button styles and removed deprecated glyphicons. - Fixed bug displaying repeated post title; now shows post text.
**post_list.html** - Added conditional check to handle empty pages. - Added links for publishing and creating posts to improve user navigation.
**urls.py** - Added login path with `LoginView` and configured logout path with `LogoutView`, redirecting to `post_list`. - Consolidated authentication paths under `accounts/` for consistent URL structure.
**views.py** - Renamed post creation view to `CreatePostView`. - Set `template_name` and `context_object_name` for `DraftListView` to ensure it renders correctly on the draft list page. - Corrected post-login redirect behavior for improved user experience.
